publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3341 Sarah Boyack: Congratulations to the Barnardo’s Charity Shop in Gorgie Road—That the Parliament congratulates the branch of Barnardo’s in Gorgie Road for winning the competition among the 59 Barnardo’s shops in Scotland to raise the most funds from recycling mobile phones; notes that it raised £800; highlights that Barnardo’s receives £3 for every mobile phone and 50p for every ink cartridge that it receives, and encourages people to recycle their old mobile phones and ink cartridges in this way to help the charity continue its valuable contribution in helping disadvantaged children and young people across Scotland.

S3M-3341 Sarah Boyack: Congratulations to the Barnardo’s Charity Shop in Gorgie Road—That the Parliament congratulates the branch of Barnardo’s in Gorgie Road for winning the competition among the 59 Barnardo’s shops in Scotland to raise the most funds from recycling mobile phones; notes that it raised £800; highlights that Barnardo’s receives £3 for every mobile phone and 50p for every ink cartridge that it receives, and encourages people to recycle their old mobile phones and ink cartridges in this way to help the charity continue its valuable contribution in helping disadvantaged children and young people across Scotland.

S3M-3341 Congratulations to the Barnardo’s Charity Shop in Gorgie Road (lodged on 29 January 2009) Shirley-Anne Somerville*, John Park*, Jackie Baillie*, Bob Doris*, Des McNulty*, Jamie McGrigor*, Kenneth Gibson*, Jim Tolson*, Claire Baker*, George Foulkes*

S3M-3341 Congratulations to the Barnardo’s Charity Shop in Gorgie Road (lodged on 29 January 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Ken Macintosh*, Angela Constance*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Peter Peacock*, Trish Godman*
S3M-3341 Congratulations to the Barnardo’s Charity Shop in Gorgie Road (lodged on 29 January 2009) Pauline McNeill*, Stuart McMillan*, Robin Harper*, Mary Mulligan*
S3M-3341 Congratulations to the Barnardo’s Charity Shop in Gorgie Road (lodged on 29 January 2009) Gil Paterson*
S3M-3341 Congratulations to the Barnardo’s Charity Shop in Gorgie Road (lodged on 29 January 2009) Karen Whitefield*
